page.title: 02THE WENT HILLS AREA-OVERVIEW
page.content: This is an agricultural area. Most of the{farming}is arable. The River Went, which gives its name to part of the area, flows through a pretty valley in the Went Hills. There is a{ {Nature Reserve} on its banks. The area is well-wooded, with mixed plantations. There is little{employment}within the area,apart from farming and those industries which serve the farms,the only other jobs are in the {hotels and restaurants. The{transport}and communication network is very important to the area. The A1/M62 Junction is very close, so there is easy access to all parts of Britain. The area is a good stopping place for travellers, as well as being a place where people can live in the country and commute to the cities and town in the Region.
